data.description:
Lighthouse is an Ethereum consensus-layer client. We provide a stable, performant and open-source implementation which is relied upon by a significant portion of the Ethereum network.

We're actively engaged in research, specification and implementation. Providing a safe and scalable base-layer is our commitment and passion.

We are now rallying towards the Deneb fork to provide scaling via L2 solutions.
data.title: Lighthouse by Sigma Prime

data.description:
Lighthouse is a governance technology lab with a mission to make DAOs more accessible and inclusive.

We have several products with different purposes, but all of them are designed to help DAOs and other decentralized organizations make better decisions.

## 1. Native iOS/Android governance apps 

Always free.

Lighthouse pulls data directly from the blockchain and sends it right to your inbox. You can create spaces around any token-related smart contract—ERC-20 tokens, ERC-721 NFTs, governance contracts, and more. The app is free for users to follow spaces and vote on proposals. If your group wants to unlock Lighthouse's advanced features, reach out to us to get started.

* Website, https://lighthouse.cx
* Docs, https://docs.lighthouse.cx


We also recently received a grant from SAFE DAO to add multisig support when voting. Due Q4 2024.

https://lighthouse.cx/download

## 2. Communications platform for DAOs and on-chain communities

https://app.lighthouse.cx/

DAO leaders can use their EOA to send verified communications to their members. Members can use their EOA to receive verified communications from DAOs they are part of.

## 3. Signals Protocol

Our recent OSS (AGPL) contribution to expanding and innovating on metagovernance in on-chain communities.

* https://github.com/0xLighthouse/signals
* https://signals.testnet.lighthouse.cx/

A protocol for prioritising community objectives in on-chain organisations paired with an incentive mechanism.

TL;DR
* Members lock governance tokens (amount × interval) to propose initiatives.
* Boosted Weight: Longer lockups boost your initiative’s weight.
* Weight Decay: Weight decays back to the initial lock amount over time.
* Thresholds: Orgs configure proposal/acceptance thresholds.
* Contributions: Anyone can contribute to initiatives with on-chain conditions (e.g., acceptance before a timestamp). 

Meta-governance
* Reduced Voting Supply: Locked governance tokens are removed from the voting pool.
* Empowering Smaller Holders: Smaller token holders can lock for longer periods to amplify their voice.
* Dynamic Priorities: Creates a ranked, on-chain priority board reflecting true community interests.

Incentives and Contributions
* Anyone can contribute/bribe to help get an inventive over the line.
* Incentive Splits: Contributions are divided (e.g., 5% fee, 30% to supporters, 65% to treasury).

A New Allocation Primitive?: 

* External committees can fund projects directly through this system, enabling inverted capital allocation.

DeFi for DAOs?

We can issue bonds for locked tokens on an AMM to achieve a secondary market. Adds new dimensions to governance token utility. 

Potential outcomes in SIGNALS

* Mitigates whale dominance by boosting smaller holders. Who are more incentives to band together and lock for longer periods.
* Transparent Priorities: Provides clear visibility into community-driven initiatives.

As builders, we’ve taken an applied research approach. We developed an MVP of the protocol during a hackathon with @RnDAO__  to gather feedback on our ideas.

Play with it and let us know what you think! We will be formalising this into a white paper (~Q4/Q1) and are open to collaborators.
data.title: Lighthouse
Lighthouse L2
data.description:
Lighthouse L2 is a web3 hackerspace, education, event, and co-working hub for regen and web3 builders in Port Harcourt, Nigeria. 

As a thriving IRL decentralized community, Lighthouse L2 serves as a gathering place for blockchain enthusiasts, developers,entrepreneurs, students and creatives who are passionate about Web3, regenerative finance (ReFi), and decentralized technologies.
data.problem: Despite growing interest in blockchain and Web3 technologies in Africa, access to education, mentorship, and collaborative infrastructure remains limited especially in underserved regions like Nigeria in Africa. Many aspiring builders, students, and creatives lack the resources, technical guidance, and inclusive environments needed to explore, learn, and build within the Web3 ecosystem. This creates a gap in local innovation, blockchain adoption, and sustainable development.
data.solution: Lighthouse L2 bridges this gap by providing a free, inclusive Web3 hackerspace and co-working hub dedicated to education, collaboration, and impact. Through hands-on workshops, regular meetups, mentorship, and access to technical resources, we empower individuals to learn and build in areas such as DeFi, ReFi, DAOs, and Layer 2 technologies. Our hub also offers free event space and co-working facilities to regenerative builders, encouraging community-led innovation, sustainability-focused projects.
data.missionSummary: At Lighthouse L2, our mission is to help people learn about Web3 and how to use blockchain technology to solve real-world problems. We teach topics like cryptocurrency, NFTs, and decentralized apps through free classes, workshops, and events. We also support young builders and entrepreneurs with guidance, resources, and a free space to work and collaborate. Most importantly, we focus on using blockchain to create solutions that are good for both people and the planet.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.title: GG22 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/lighthouse-web3/

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: nandit123

questions.query: Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation: Via one single SDK, Lighthouse provides upload to ipfs and filecoin, as well as encryption and access control. This simplicity saves a lot of development time for developers and projects who previously had to use different SDK for ipfs, filecoin and use a third party encryption /token gating sdks

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
1. Lighthouse Files - Easy to use onboarding dashboard for users to login, upload and share files. Pay using Fiat via Stripe and crypto on Filecoin. Get at least 2 storage proofs (PoST - Proof of Space Time) daily with miners to verify. Website - https://files.lighthouse.storage/

2. Lighthouse Kavach - Our Encryption SDK allows users to store private data and build token-gated applications. Enabling use cases - time-locked retrievals, token gate by NFTs & token balances, custom onchain contract logic. Available for EVM and https://github.com/lighthouse-web3/encryption-sdk

3. Programmable storage - Deployed our contracts on Mainnet enabling users to configure all parameters like Renewal frequency, Replications and Repair policy onchain using power of Filecoin Virtual Machine enabling use cases like Perpetual Storage, Data DAOs and complementing Data Availability Layers.

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Total users - 17k, 
Total data objects uploaded - 2.87Million
Total data size processed - 2TiB+

Open-source projects on github who integrated Lighthouse - 900+ (and many more closed source)

 have been able to onboard some of the top projects in web3 to store their data on Lighthouse, like the following -

AI - Singularity Net, Ocean protocol, Eternal AI, etc.

NFT - NFT.Storage, FileMarket, OkContract, etc.

DA - Syscoin, BVM Network, Zeeve RaaS, etc.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
We plan to build more robust products on data layer. We already have ipfs, filecoin offerings and encryption/token gating. Next we want to bring zkTLS proofs aggregation directly from Lighthouse SDK, we have a POC with one zkTLS provider like reclaim protocol and plan to add more like opacity.

We also plan to decentralize using eigen avs and arbitrum stack as it aligns with our long term goal of preserving data.

Along the way, we want to make sure that our engineering and infrastructure scales along the way and is robust with growing demand. So we plan to introduce new development pipeline and infrastructure orchestration to enable easy and fast storage, reliable encryption and key management long-term.

data.title: GG23 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.explanation: nanditmehra

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/lighthouse-web3

questions.query: Link to your Public Group Chat
questions.explanation: https://t.me/lighthouseStorage

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds
questions.explanation: GG22

questions.query: Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
Lighthouse is a perpetual storage system for AI, DePin, and NFTs. 

We have easy-to-use SDKs in JS, Python, APIs with Smart Contracts on EVM Chains like Filecoin Virtual Machine, Polygon, etc. that devs can use to integrate in their apps easily.

Teams rely on Lighthouse to store data on IPFS, Filecoin. We also have threshold encryption SDK to store private data and build token gated dapps with support for web3 wallets signatures, passkeys, etc.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
Our SDKs are available in popular languages like JS and Python. Using Lighthouse allows devs to access, store and retrieve on decentralized storage from one single SDK and without need of setting up any complex infra on their own. 

Development time is reduced from couple of days to few hours using Lighthouse SDK. We also provide an easy to use web interface at https://files.lighthouse.storage/ that anyone can use to authenticate and store on decentralized storage.

We also provide a comprehensive documentation on https://docs.lighthouse.storage/lighthouse-1

Many top L1, L2s like Polygon, Astar Network, Cosmos chains, etc. have recommended Lighthouse in their docs too.

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Trusted by thousands of dapps and securing millions of data objects.

- Current users: 19k+

- Files objects stored: 5.5M+

- Data Stored: 6.6Tib+

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
We will be allocating funds to scale our engineering capabilities to handle bigger data sizes and potentially 10s of millions of new objects scale into the future.

We are bring new updates to our sdk to improve our upload, encryption flows as well. 

Python is also becoming a goto language for web3 devs because of its agentic use in AI x crypto apps and we want to improve our python SDK to support more functions and capabilities too.
